data.content:
❌ 1. chrome.storage has EXTREMELY small storage

Limits:

chrome.storage.sync → 100KB total

chrome.storage.local → 5MB max

Your NGO documents will be:

PDF (2–20MB each)

Word files

Images

Scanned certificates

➡ They will NOT fit in chrome.storage.Even one PDF breaks the limit.



❌ 2. chrome.storage cannot store files

It can store ONLY:

strings

JSON

small base64 data

It cannot store large PDFs or DOCX files properly.

To store 5MB PDF, you must convert to base64 → becomes 7MB → FAIL.



❌ 3. Data is lost if user clears browser

If user:

uninstalls the extension

clears cookies

clears browser storage

➡ All NGO documents are permanently lostYou have no backup.

This is VERY risky for NGO official documents.



❌ 4. chrome.storage works only on one device

If user uploads documents on:

Laptop → ✓Phone → ❌ (extension not synced)Another laptop → ❌

There is no multi-device syncing.

NGO team members cannot share documents.



❌ 5. No security

chrome.storage is stored inside the browser.

Anyone can:

Open DevTools → Application → chrome.storage

View all data

Edit all data

Delete all data

No encryption.No access control.Not safe for personal or NGO data.



❌ 6. No user accounts / No login

Your project needs:

multiple NGOs

each NGO with separate files

secure authentication

role-based access

chrome.storage does not support login.Everything is stored together.



❌ 7. Not scalable

Today: 2 PDFsTomorrow: 20–200 documents

chrome.storage will fail.

Your AI features (RAG, system prompt, autofill) need a reliable document store.



❌ 8. Not accessible by backend / cloud

chrome.storage is local to the browser.

Your backend MCP server cannot fetch documents stored inside chrome.storage.

But your autofill workflow needs:

Browser Extension → Backend (MCP) → AI Model → Playwright → Autofill

Back-end cannot access chrome.storage → breaks workflo
